info.name: Minha Visita Testes
info.description:
This documentation demonstrates how to integrate with the MinhaVisita public API. There are two levels of integration, endpoint only or fully integrated logic. The first is the standard HTTP integration, it allows some operations and access to some features, if you need more control or even advanced features (such as triggers) you have to use the second. This documentation covers only the first level of integration (HTTP), if your approach needs more features, contact us: [suporte@minhavisita.com.br](mailto:suporte@minhavisita.com.br). ## Autentication First you need to contact the support team, via email [suporte@minhavisita.com.br](mailto:suporte@minhavisita.com.br), to request a set of public and private keys. With these keys you will be able to log into the application. The login response contains the actions that can be performed, as well as the access key. To perform any kind of action on the API, it is necessary to send all three keys (private, public and access) in the request header. Query Language To simplify lookups, a query language is used in GET routes. The query is an encoded JSON object sent in the route (query parameter). The object defaults to: ***`{ "select": FIELDS, "where": FILTERS, "limit": LIMIT, "offset": OFFSET, }`*** Only the selected attribute is required. * `select` (Array | Object): An array that defines which fields you want to get * To receive custom fields, an object in the following format must be sent: * `{ "column_X": true, "column_Y": true, "customs": [ 123, 456 ] }` * Common fields must hold the value ***true*** because of the JSON standard * `where` ( object ): Defines the filters to be applied to the query. * `limit` ( number ): Indicates the maximum limit of records, up to 1000, to be returned by the query. * `offset` (number ): The compartmentalization of the query result. Should only be used in limited sets. For better understanding of the pattern, you should check any example using GET routes in this documentation. ## Encoding The process for encoding a query consists of the following: Construct the object according to the given pattern using a JSON string. encode the JSON string in a base 64 code. Subsequently, append the encoded string to the route, where the fianl route will be: GET - /entity?query=ENCODED_STRING ## Limitation Most servers do not accept GET requests longer than 2000 characters. In case of very long queries it is necessary to make a different request: Using the same entity, the verb should be changed from GET to POST. Put the encoded query in the body of the request. Change the Content-type header to query. Summary example of the changes: | **FROM** | **To** | | --- | --- | | Content-type: text/plain
GET - /entity?
query=LONG_ENCODED_STRING
Body: | Content-type: query
POST - /entity
Body: LONG_ENCODED_STRING | ## Error Handling The API will always return 200 regarding the status of the response, when an error occurs, a standard JSON object will be returned, containing the error information. `{"status": ERROR_STATUS, "msg": ERROR_MESSAGE, "description": ERROR_DESCRIPTION }` Common error states and messages are: * (`400`) `error_invalid_input`: you are trying to submit a invalid field. * (`403`) `invalid_permission`: the action you are trying to perform are not allowed to your login. * (`500`) `internal_error`: internal server error. * **Important**: This may indicate an error in your account settings, please contact us at [suporte@minhavisita.com.br](mailto:suporte@minhavisita.com.br). **Important**: Non-standard errors mean critical integration problems, such as Keys and Logins. In this case, please contact us at [suporte@minhavisita.com.br](mailto:suporte@minhavisita.com.br) ## API ### Actions This section describes the meaning of the set of actions returned in the Login route. * `search`: you are allowed to perform search queries in this entity. * `create`: you are allowed to create entries of this entity. * `update`: you are allowed to update entries of this entity. * `disable`: you are allowed to deactivate entries of this entity. * `enable`: you are allowed to reactivate entries of this entity. ### Filtering You can use a pattern to perform more complex filters, it can be used like this: `{ "filter_X": 12, // normal filter "customs": { 123: { // customized filter ">": 10, "<": 15 } } }` | Operator | Description | | --- | --- | | `>` | Greater than | | `<` | Less than | | `>=` | Greater than or equal to | | `<=` | Less than or equal to | | `!=` or `<>` | Different from | Important: the logic relation between the filters, event the complex ones, is an AND. ### Response Type It is possible to change the response format for yours `GET` requests. To do so you just need to send another query parameter in the route: `GET - /entity?query=ENCODED_STRING&type=RESPONSE_TYPE` The possible types are: `CSV` and `JSON`. ## Entities The entities present fields and filters that are allowed in requests. The description of the fields and filters equivalent to each entity is described in the routing section.

item.description:
In Minha Visita, applications are extra functionalities contracted with the existing store in the administrative panel.  
The following table shows the fields that are part of this entity.

| **Campo** | **Type** | **Descrição** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| nome | `string` | Application Name |
| moeda | `string` | Currency in which the app is charged |
| valor | `number` | App Value |
| valor_cotacao | `number` |  |
| gratuito | `bool` | Indicates whether the application installation is free or not |
| ativo | `bool` | Indicates if the application is active |
| instalado_padrao | `bool` |  |

item.description:
In Minha Visita, checks are the main entity of the system, representing a trackable user activity, recorded by the user with a status about the customer.  
Checks are actions like: John made a sale to Bob .  
The following is the list of fields that can be accessed from the check entity

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| id_checkin | `number` | The id of the check |
| observacao | `string` | The observation of the check |
| cidade | `string` | The city of the check |
| endereco | `string` | The address of the check |
| pais | `string` | The country of the check |
| latitude | `number` |  |
| longitude | `number` |  |
| data_cadastro | `datetime` | The register date of the check |
| ativo | `string` | The active of the check (S = Yes, N = No) |
| customs | `object` | The custom fields of the check |
| cliente | `object` | The Customer entry related to the check |
| id_status | `int` | ID the Status entry related to the check |
| usuario | `object` | The User entry related to the check |
| hashtags | `array` | The Trend entries related to the check |
| comentarios | `array` | The CheckComment entries related to the check |
| imagens | `array` | The CheckImage entries related to the check |
| Filter | Type | Description |
| id_checkin | `number` | Filter check by id |
| id_cliente | `number` | Filter check by customer id |
| id_status | `number` | Filter check by status id |
| id_usuario | `number` | Filter check by user id |
| data_cadastro | `datetime` | Filter check by register date |
| ativo | `bool` | Filter check by activeness |

### CheckComment

Checks can contain comments, which are described in the fields below.

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| id_comentario | `number` | The id of the comment |
| comentario | `string` | The comment content |
| data_cadastro | `datetime` | The register date of the comment |
| usuario | `object` | The User entry related to the comment |

### CheckImage

Checks can have images associated with them. The fields available for this information are described below.

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| id_imagem | `number` | The id of the image |
| url | `string` | The link of the image |
| url_thumb | `string` | The link of the image thumb |
| galeria | `string` | If the image came from the phone gallery (S = Yes, N = No) |

request.description:
This route, is used for the creation of a new client. You should only send the fields that you want to persist.  
The owner of the customer is who, in the company, have access (check it or edit it) to this customer.  
There are three possible owners, you should only send one of this fields:

*   `id_usuario`: (id of user) the customer is assigned to a specific user.
*   `ids_times`: (ids of teams) the customer is assigned to certain teams.
*   `id_empresa`: (boolean) the customer is public, everyone in the company can access it.

item.description:
In Minha Visita, customers are those entities where a user will perform checks. It is common for customers to have custom fields.

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| id_cliente | `number` | The id of the customer |
| nome | `string` | The name of the customer |
| endereco | `string` | The address of the customer |
| latitude | `number` |  |
| longitude | `number` |  |
| data_cadastro | `datetime` | The register date of the customer |
| ativo | `string` | The active of the customer (S = Yes, N = No) |
| dono | `object` | The owner of the customer |
|  | `id` | The id of the owner |
|  | `tipo` | The type of the owner, could be USUARIO (User), EMPRESA (Public), TIME (Team) |
| customs | `object` | The custom fields of the customer |
| status | `object` | The CustomerStatus entry related to the customer |
| Filter | Type | Description |
| id_cliente | `number` | Filter customer by id |
| id_status | `number` | Filter customer by CustomerStatus id |
| id_usuario | `number` | Filter customer by user id (owner) |
| id_time | `number` | Filter customer by team id (owner) |
| id_empresa | `number` | Filter customer by company (owner) |
| data_cadastro | `datetime` | Filter customer by register date |
| ativo | `bool` | Filter customer by activeness |

### CustomerStatus

Customers can also have statuses associated with them. These statuses can indicate a service classification or customer category.

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| id_cliente_status | `number` | The id of the customer status |
| nome | `string` | The name of the customer status |
| data_cadastro | `datetime` | The register date of the customer status |
| ativo | `bool` | The active of the customer status (S = Yes, N = No) |
| Filter | Type | Description |
| id_cliente_status | `number` | Filter customer status by id |
| ativo | `bool` | Filter customer status by activeness |

item.description:
In Minha Visita, customs fields are, as the name implies, custom fields that can be attached to a record.  
It is used to extend the possible values stored by an entity type, the actual entities that support custom fields are:

*   CHECK: fields attached to **Check**
*   LOCAL: fields attached to **Cliente** .
    

### Field Custom

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| id_status | `int` | Unique Field Identifier |
| nome | `string` | Name that identifies the field |
| id_tipo | `string` | Field type identifier |
| entidade | `string` | Indicates which entity the field belongs to |
| editavel | `bool` | Indicates whether the field can be edited |
| visivel | `bool` | Indicates the visibility of the field |
| obrigatorio | `bool` | Indicates the requirement to assign values to the field |
| ordem | `int` | Indicates the order in which the field is presented in relation to the other custom fields. |
| tamanho | `int` | Indicates how many characters the assigned value can reach. |
| id_empresa | `int` | Identifier of the company with which the field is associated. |
| data_cadastro | `date` | Date on which the field was recorded |

*   texto

*   select
*   data
*   data_hora
*   telefone
*   celular
*   email
*   decimal

item.name: REGIONS

request.description:
This route searches the regions associated with the company. The query parameter receives as value a JSON representation encoded in base64, containing the search specifications.

The following describes the fields that can be part of the search.

**Campos da consulta (select)**

| Campo | Descrição |
| --- | --- |
| id_regiao | Unique Identifier |
| nome | Region name |
| latitude | Latitude position |
| longitude | Longitude position |
| zoom | Zoom Level |
| tipo | Type of region |
| id_empresa | Region-related company identifier |
| default | Indicates whether the region is default |
| lang | Language assigned to the region |
| ativo | Indicator whether the region is active or not |
| id_usuario_atualizado | Identifier of the user who created the region |

**Campos de filtro (where)**

| **Campo** | **Valor** |
| --- | --- |
| id_regiao | Region identifier or array containing a list of identifiers. |
| nome | Region name in string format |
| latitude | Latitude in float number format |
| longitude | Longitude in float number format |
| zoom | Display Scale in Integer Format |
| tipo | Identification of the type of region in string format |
| id_empresa | Unique identifier of the company associated with the region |
| default | S/N |
| lang | Ex: pt-br |
| ativo | S/N |
| id_usuario_atualizado | User ID |

**Limite de registros (limit)**

Receives an integer value. If no limit is entered, a maximum of 100 records will be returned.

**Paginação (offset)**

Defines which block of the recordset will be reported, determined by the given record limit.

item.description:
In My Visit, trends are the hashtags entered in the checkin remark that attach trackable information to it. There are two types of trends: * **Trending**: used to track some field data. (like #SmallBussiness) * **Product Trend**: used to include products in the checkin. (like #Product1) The following table describes the fields and filters that are part of the trend report. |
Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | id_tendencia | `number` | The id of the trend | | nome | `string` | The name of the trend | | categoria | `string` | The category of the trend (N = Normal, P = Product) | | quantidade | `number` | The quantity of the product trend | | valor_unitario | `number` | The unit value of the product trend | | codigo | `string` | The personal code of the product trend | | ativo | `string` | The active of the status (S = Yes, N = No) | | Filter | Type | Description | | id_tendencia | `number` | Filter trend by id | | ativo | `bool` | Filter trend by activeness |

item.description:
No Minha Visita, a entidade usuário está associada a uma empresa, podendo um usuário pertencer a outro usuário, chamado usuário pai.

Na tabela a seguir, são descritos os campos que compõe a entidade usuário.

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| id_usuario | `number` | The id of the user |
| nome | `string` | The name of the user |
| tipo_usuario | `string` | The type of the user (A = Administrator, G = Manager, R = Trade Representative, V = Salesman) |
| email | `string` | The email of the user |
| telefone | `string` | The phone number of the user |
| data_cadastro | `datetime` | The register date of the user |
| ativo | `bool` | The active of the user (S = Yes, N = No) |
| Filter | Type | Description |
| id_usuario | `number` | Filter user by id |
| ativo | `bool` | Filter user by activeness |

item.description:
In Minha Visita, a company represents the information of the client that against the APP Minha Visita. The company API allows the management of this data.

### Company

| **Field** | **type** | **Description** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| id_empresa | `int` | The ID of the company |
| nome | `string` | The name of the company |
| telefone | `string` | The phone number of the company |
| nome_usuario | `string` | The name of the user main of the company |
| email | `string` | The email of the company and user main. |
| senha | `string` | The password of the user main |
| nacionalidade | `string` | The nationality of the company |
| lang | `string` | The language of the company |
| timezone | `string` | The timezone of the company |
| formato_hora | `number` | The time format of the company |
| setor | `string` | The sector of activity of the company |
| como_conheceu | `string` | How did you find out about the minhavisita app |
| quantidade_usuario_cadastro | `string` | Number of users registered by the company |
| is_gestor | `string` or `bool` | Indicates whether the user is the account manager |
| tipo_equipe | `string` | Company team type |
| interesse_treinamento | `string` or `bool` | The company have interest in training |
| cadastro_novo | `char` | This is new registration |
